department.dept_long_name: Department of Romance Languages and Literatures

course.title: Intermediate Spanish
course.meeting_text: Sections M. through Th., at 9, 10, 11, or 1
course.faculty_text: Adriana Gutierrez and members of the Department
course.description: An intermediate language and culture class that aims to consolidate and expand the skills of listening comprehension, speaking, reading and writing in Spanish. Includes a comprehensive review of the grammar and reinforces linguistic acquisition through texts, movies, art and multi-media projects to acquaint students with cultural issues relevant to the Spanish-speaking world.
course.prerequisites: Spanish Ab, Acd, 451-600 on the SAT II test or on the Harvard Placement Test, or permission of course head.
course.notes: Conducted in Spanish. May not be taken Pass/Fail, but may be taken Sat/Unsat by GSAS students. Not open to auditors. Section on-line on the Spanish C website. Upon the recommendation of the course head, students who have performed at a superior level in this course may enroll in any course for which they are linguistically prepared.
